channel.title: Go tutorials and examples.
channel.description: Recent content on Go tutorials and examples.

item.title: How to create a file in go
item.description: Go lets you easily create and write a new file. Here is an example using create from os package. package main import "os" func main() { //create a file f, err := os.Create("foo") if err != nil { panic(err) } //make sure it closes. defer f.Close() } os.Create creates a file with default mode 0666 , and default file descriptor as O_RDWR . Here is another explicit example package main import "os" func main() { f, err := os.
